movesets.name: Mega Special Attacker
movesets.description:
Moves

The choice between Psychic and Psyshock mainly comes down to personal preference. Psychic hits significantly harder in general, as well as hitting Landorus-T, Gliscor, Rotom-W, and Quagsire much harder than Psyshock, but Psyshock is still a nice tool because it allows Mega Alakazam to deal very solid damage to Chansey and OHKO Assault Vest Conkeldurr. Focus Blast is specifically for Dark- and Steel-types such as Tyranitar, Heatran, Ferrothorn, and Greninja. Skarmory and Forretress are also easily 2HKOed by the move due to their low Special Defense stat. Taunt is incredibly useful for shutting down defensive teams, opening the door for a sweeper to come in and set up on them or allowing Mega Alakazam to tear them apart itself. It can also prevent Thundurus from crippling Mega Alakazam with Thunder Wave once it Traces Prankster. Shadow Ball hits opposing Psychic-types very hard. However, if you pair Mega Alakazam with a Pursuit trapper, Hidden Power Fire is useful for OHKOing bulky Mega Scizor, otherwise it has no issue setting up on Mega Alakazam.

Dazzling Gleam is also a great option in the last slot because it allows Mega Alakazam to always OHKO Swift Swim Kingdra after Stealth Rock, a noteworthy threat that Mega Alazakam is able to revenge kill thanks to its new ability, Trace. It also hits other Dragon-types such as Garchomp and Dragonite harder than anything else, as well as 2HKOing physically defensive Mandibuzz. Hidden Power Ice always secures the OHKO on Landorus-T, Gliscor, and Landorus, but Psychic deals enough damage to them anyway. Encore can help Mega Alakazam against Sucker Punch users such as Bisharp if predicted correctly, and it can also help against other Pokemon such as set up sweepers and Chansey.

Set Details

Maxing out both Speed and Special Attack is essential in order to make Mega Alakazam as threatening and fast as possible. Alakazite allows Alakazam to Mega Evolve and achieve a massive boost in Speed and Special Attack, and a slight increase in physical bulk. Unlike with normal Alakazam, a Modest nature is preferred because Mega Alakazam is already so fast that there aren't too many noteworthy things that outspeed it with Timid, so you're better off giving it as much power as possible. It should be noted that even with a Modest nature, Mega Alakazam can still outspeed Adamant Mega Gyarados and Jolly Mega Tyranitar at +1.

Usage Tips

Unlike regular Alakazam, Mega Alakazam can outspeed almost the entirety of the unboosted metagame even with a Modest nature, allowing it to hit just as hard as standard Life Orb Alakazam and with higher Speed to boot. It is meant to function as a potent wallbreaker and revenge killer, making it a perfect fit for offensive teams in need of a powerful special attacker. Although it loses out on the useful residual damage immunity that Magic Guard brings, Trace gives Mega Alakazam an interesting niche because it allows it to use the opponent's abilities against themselves. For example, it can copy Kabutop's Swift Swim and revenge kill it, copy Heatran's Flash Fire ability to make it immune to Fire-type attacks, and copy Greninja's Protean ability so it can obtain STAB on all of its coverage moves. Keep in mind that even with these interesting attributes, Mega Alakazam is more prone to being revenge killed than normal Alakazam because of its lack of a Focus Sash and Magic Guard, so getting rid of priority users is of great importance.

Team Options

Fighting-types such as Keldeo, Breloom, and Lucario, as well as other powerful physical attackers, are very important partners because they can break through Chansey, which can easily sponge any of Mega Alakazam's attacks. Pursuit Bisharp is basically a mandatory partner to this set, otherwise Mega Alakazam will have trouble with Latias. Heatran can deal with Talonflame, Bisharp, and Scizor, which all threaten Mega Alakazam with their priority moves. Much like the previous set, entry hazard support is incredibly important for securing important OHKOs and 2HKOs, so pairing Mega Alakazam with common entry hazards users such as Ferrothorn, Skarmory, or Landorus-T is a must. Landorus-T and Rotom-W can also check a lot of physical attackers that threaten Mega Alakazam, such as Scizor and Talonflame.

movesets.name: Revenge Killer

items.name: Focus Sash
items.description: The holder always survives one attack. One-time use.

movesets.description:
Moves

Psyshock is very important for dealing solid damage to Pokemon with higher Special Defense, such as Chansey and Assault Vest Conkeldurr, while annihilating Poison- and Fighting-types. Focus Blast provides this set with much-needed—albeit unreliable—coverage against Tyranitar, Heatran, and Ferrothorn, which would wall this set otherwise. Shadow Ball hits opposing Psychic-types such as Latias and Slowbro. Hidden Power Ice is the preferred choice overall in the last slot because it hits a plethora of threats, such as Gliscor, Landorus, Garchomp, and Dragonite. Thunder Wave on the other hand allows Alakazam to cripple set up sweepers such as Mega Gyarados, Mega Charizard X, and Dragonite at any point in the battle as long as its Focus Sash is still intact.

There are a few other move options that Alakazam can run on this set. Psychic is an option over Psyshock to hit Hippowdon and physically defensive Rotom-W harder, but it fails to do anything to Blissey, Chansey, Sylveon, and Goodra. Dazzling Gleam is a much more reliable option to hit Dark-types, but it's incredibly weak compared to Focus Blast, and it misses out on the ability to OHKO Tyranitar, among many other things. Hidden Power Fire hits Scizor, Ferrothorn, and Skarmory harder than anything else.

Set Details

With a Focus Sash, Alakazam becomes an amazing revenge killer thanks to its immunity to all forms of residual damage, which ensures that Alakazam has to be hit a minimum of two times before going down.

Usage Tips

The main purpose of this set is to take advantage of Alakazam's attributes in order for it to become a formidable revenge killer. Because of this, it fits best on offensive teams, as it is able to outspeed and revenge kill a large variety of Pokemon that give these teams trouble. Due to Alakazam's mediocre defenses, it is very important to only send it in on something it can OHKO, or else Alakazam becomes very vulnerable to being OHKOed in return or having its Focus Sash broken. However, as long as Focus Sash is intact, Alakazam has the ability to revenge kill Choice Scarf users such as Landorus-T, Terrakion, and Garchomp, giving it a huge advantage over other revenge killers.

Team Options

Alakazam appreciates being paired with Pokemon that can beat its common checks and counters. Fighting-types such as Lucario, Keldeo, and Terrakion can easily blast through Chansey, Tyranitar, and other special walls that are able to sponge Alakazam's attacks. Breloom is an incredible offensive partner because it can check a wide range of Pokemon that give Alakazam trouble, such as Bisharp, Azumarill, Weavile, and Greninja. Entry hazard support from the likes of Skarmory and Ferrothorn can really help weaken down opposing threats so they can be revenge killed more efficiently.

moves.name: Ally Switch
moves.description: Switches position with another Pokemon on user's side of the field.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Barrier
moves.description: Boosts Defense by 2 stages.

moves.name: Body Slam
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Calm Mind
moves.description: Boosts Special Attack and Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Captivate
moves.description: Lowers an opposite gender foe's Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Charge Beam
moves.description: 70% chance to boost Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Confusion
moves.description: 10% chance to confuse.

moves.name: Counter
moves.description: If hit by a physical attack, returns double the damage.

moves.name: Dazzling Gleam
moves.description: Deals damage to all adjacent foes.

moves.name: Disable
moves.description: Prevents the last move used from being used again for 2-5 turns.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Double-Edge
moves.description: Has 1/3 recoil.

moves.name: Drain Punch
moves.description: Leeches 50% damage.

moves.name: Dream Eater
moves.description: Leeches 50% of the damage dealt. Only works if target is asleep.

moves.name: Dynamic Punch
moves.description: Confuses the foe.

moves.name: Embargo
moves.description: Item use is prevented for five turns.

moves.name: Encore
moves.description: Causes the target to repeat the last move for 2-5 turns.

moves.name: Endure
moves.description: The user always survives with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Energy Ball
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Fire Punch
moves.description: 10% chance to burn.

moves.name: Flash
moves.description: Lowers foe's accuracy 1 stage.

moves.name: Fling
moves.description: Throws the user's hold item at the foe. Power and effect depend on the item.

moves.name: Focus Blast
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Focus Punch
moves.description: Fails if the user takes damage before it hits.

moves.name: Foul Play
moves.description: Uses the target's Attack stat in damage calculation.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Future Sight
moves.description: Deals damage at the end of the turn after three turns.

moves.name: Giga Impact
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Grass Knot
moves.description: Deals damage based on the foe's weight.

moves.name: Gravity
moves.description: For 5 turns, prevents flying or jumping; also disables Ground immunities.

moves.name: Guard Split
moves.description: Averages Defense and Special Defense stats of the user with the target.

moves.name: Guard Swap
moves.description: Swaps Defense and Special Defense boosts and drops.

moves.name: Headbutt
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch the target.

moves.name: Hidden Power Bug
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Dark
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Dragon
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hyper Beam
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Ice Punch
moves.description: 10% chance to freeze the target.

moves.name: Iron Tail
moves.description: 30% chance to lower Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Kinesis
moves.description: Lowers target's accuracy by 1 stage.

moves.name: Knock Off
moves.description: Power is boosted 1.5x if user is holding a removable item. Removes the target's item.

moves.name: Light Screen
moves.description: Lowers damage from special attacks for 5 turns.

moves.name: Magic Coat
moves.description: Bounces back certain non-damaging moves.

moves.name: Magic Room
moves.description: Held items have no effect for 5 turns.

moves.name: Mega Kick
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Mega Punch
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Metronome
moves.description: Picks a random move.

moves.name: Mimic
moves.description: Copies the last move used by the target.

moves.name: Miracle Eye
moves.description: Nullifies evasion. Allows Psychic-type moves to hit Darks.

moves.name: Natural Gift
moves.description: Power and type depends on the user's held Berry.

moves.name: Nightmare
moves.description: Does 1/4 of the target's max HP per turn to a sleeping target.

moves.name: Power Trick
moves.description: Swaps user's Attack and Defense stats.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Psybeam
moves.description: 10% chance to confuse.

moves.name: Psych Up
moves.description: Copies the foe's stat changes.

moves.name: Psychic
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense 1 stage.

moves.name: Psycho Cut
moves.description: Has a high critical hit rate.

moves.name: Psycho Shift
moves.description: Shifts the user's status effect to the foe.

moves.name: Psyshock
moves.description: Damage is based on the target's Defense stat.

moves.name: Rain Dance
moves.description: Summons rain for 5 turns.

moves.name: Recover
moves.description: Heals 50% of user's max HP.

moves.name: Recycle
moves.description: Restores a used up item.

moves.name: Reflect
moves.description: Lowers damage from physical attacks for 5 turns.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Role Play
moves.description: Copies the foe's ability and overwrites the user's ability.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Safeguard
moves.description: Blocks status conditions for 5 turns.

moves.name: Secret Power
moves.description: Effects vary with terrain.

moves.name: Seismic Toss
moves.description: Does damage equal to the user's level.

moves.name: Shadow Ball
moves.description: 20% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Shock Wave
moves.description: Ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Signal Beam
moves.description: 10% chance to confuse.

moves.name: Skill Swap
moves.description: The user and the target trade abilities.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Snatch
moves.description: If certain moves are used, the user of Snatch uses the moves instead.

moves.name: Snore
moves.description: Can only be used while sleeping. 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.description: Takes 1/4 the user's max HP to create a Substitute that takes damage for the user.

moves.name: Sunny Day
moves.description: Summons sun for 5 turns.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Taunt
moves.description: Forces the foe to use damaging moves for 2 turns.

moves.name: Telekinesis
moves.description: Lasts 3 turns and makes all moves hit the target.  Makes target immune to Ground-type moves.

moves.name: Teleport
moves.description: Has no effect.

moves.name: Thief
moves.description: Steals target's item.

moves.name: Thunder Punch
moves.description: 10% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Thunder Wave
moves.description: Paralyzes the foe.

moves.name: Torment
moves.description: Prevents the target from using the same move twice in a row.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: Trick
moves.description: Switches items with the foe.

moves.name: Trick Room
moves.description: Slower Pokemon move first for 5 turns.

moves.name: Wonder Room
moves.description: Swaps Defense and Special Defense of all Pokemon.

moves.name: Zen Headbutt
moves.description: 20% chance to flinch.

abilities.name: Synchronize
abilities.description: When statused, the enemy is also statused. Can pass nature to wild Pokemon.
